intro: Peperomia fundacionensis, commonly known as the Fundación peperomia, is a species of flowering plant native to Ecuador. It belongs to the Piperaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and thick, waxy leaves. The plant typically features small, clustered inflorescences with pale green to white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
